conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-style render with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible room volume, and roof/ceiling removed to expose interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes; angled view with minimal distortion; cutaway is clean with continuous wall geometry. Minor simplification in some wall top/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (bedroom, living/dining, kitchen, toilet, utility, balcony/foyer zone). Relative proportions are close; however some openings/partition extents appear slightly simplified (e.g., foyer/entry demarcation and a few door swing placements not perfectly mirrored).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present in correct spaces (bed in bedroom, sofa/dining in living, kitchen counter/cooktop, bathroom fixtures). Some elements are simplified blocks and not all storage/utility details from plan are fully represented.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and the model is readable; lighting supports visibility. Minor softness/blur and simplified materials reduce crispness but no major artifacts or UI/text contamination.

detected_errors.description: Some door/opening placements and swing indications appear simplified or not perfectly aligned with the 2D plan (notably around foyer/kitchen/living transitions).
Minor layout simplification in partition/foyer delineation and built-in elements (plan shows more explicit foyer boundary and some detailing that is reduced in 3D).
Furniture and cabinetry are simplified; some built-in/utility details are not fully modeled compared to the plan.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and readable interiors, with only minor opening/partition simplifications versus the 2D plan.
